reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were really pleased with our choice of hotels for our overnight stay in Kiruna. The hotel is right across the street from the train station and a short walk from the bus station and the city center.
reviews.title: Nice accommodations & good location

reviews.text: The room was clean and nicely decorated, with everything we needed. The complimentary buffet breakfast was great and included lots of choices. There is free Wi-Fi, including a public computer in the lobby for guest use. I wish we had more time to take advantage of the spa area - maybe next time.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!

reviews.text: The Hotel Vinterpalatset was wonderful.
reviews.title: Experience the midnight sun shining through your window

reviews.text: The room was comfortable, and the bathroom large and well arranged by European standards. I particularly enjoyed the large shower, which did not leak water on the bathroom floor (one of pet peeves).
reviews.title: A wonderful little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room and the common areas are very clean and well kept. The management and the staff really care about keeping this place pristine.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a night on our way back to Stockholm from Abisko. The room allocated to us was nice, and more importantly very clean. The furniture was just right and was adding the value to the room. Location is quite convenient and we could walk to the city center in a few minutes.
reviews.title: Very good hotel and affordable too!

reviews.text: Staff assisted us to pre-book a cab to reach Kiruna airport and also helped in packing the breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent staff

reviews.text: Vinterpalatset is definitely an excellent value-for-money hotel and would recommend to other fellow travellers to Kiruna.
reviews.title: Nice and cosy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were excellent. Thy went out of their way to help us feel comfortable. They gave us dishes and crockery/ cutlery to eat our own food in.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel in a quiet area

reviews.text: Location is excellent.
reviews.title: Very good & affordable

reviews.text: Very convenient location and helpful and friendly reception. Comfy and warm beddings too although the matress is too soft for me. Room is of good size, shower temp a bit unstable but acceptable. Good breakfast. At this price (150 euros) this is a very good deal. Unfortunately for this good hotel and the friendly bus-driver we came across on Bus 501, Kiruna is not a place for tourists. This is a very boring town with nothing to see. Go to Abisko for the northern lights if you happen to be in Sweden for this.
reviews.title: Very good service

reviews.text: Chose this hotel on the basis of the previous reviews and they were all spot on. Comfortable, clean, great breakfast, very helpful staff, good location... As a base for activities in the surrounding area it totally fits the bill. Stayed a couple of nights for a winter trip and would definitely stay here again if I ever return to Kiruna.
reviews.title: Everything you need for a stay in Kiruna

reviews.text: The hotel is just five minutes walk from the bus and train station and also from the city centre. The rooms are clean and reasonable in size. The people at the reception are quite welcoming and friendly. The hotel has a bar on the first floor and offers free sauna and jacuzzi to guests.
reviews.title: Clean affordable hotel at a great location

reviews.text: There is one PC near the reception for people who want to use the internet. WIFI was available for free in all rooms and had good connection.
reviews.title: Just what we were looking for.

reviews.text: I think for the location, friendliness of staff and the affordability it's a certain delight.
reviews.title: Great location, spacious rooms and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Hotell Vinterpalaset on our way to Abisko National Park to see the Northern Lights (which we did!) and were very happy to have found this little gem. It's conveniently located close to the train station and oozes Swedishness in its style and colours.
reviews.title: peaceful pastels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we had was very big, had all the amenities and was also nice and quiet. I loved the white and pastel colours and simple Swedish furniture; it gave the place a somewhat rural feel - good old-fashioned clean Swedish country living.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in Kiruna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was sumptuous and the breakfast room had that same quiet elegance .
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The personnel was efficient and correct, though quite reserved, so don't expect boisterous conversations with the landlady!
reviews.title: Traditional Swedish House

reviews.text: Kiruna town itself is hardly worth a visit, but the surroundings are supposedly beautiful. We strolled to the station the next morning, only to find that our train had been cancelled. The replacement bus arrived 1.5 hrs later. If we had known that we would have stayed in our lovely room a bit longer!
reviews.title: Quiet but friendly
